result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamal A. Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kamal A. Owens is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kamal A. Owens was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Kamal A. Owens was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Maintain full time employment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not have contact with victim, unless otherwise permitted by the agent & victim.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamal A. Owens

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Judge Kluka acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Smathers appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty Wm. Michel.  VRC.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent.  See conditions.  DNA ordered.  Appeal rights.  If revoked, credit for 3 days.

Defendant, Kamal A. Owens, appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
at the request of Atty Michel. PH on 04-01 is rescheduled to 03-31 at 10:30am Intake   DA notified.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued and Reinstated 
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Jennifer A, Yvonne T-G.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's J.A. & Y. T-G.'s residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 4/1/22 @ 900am.  Signature bond is reinstated and continued as previously set.     jk
